title: Oasis - (What's the Story) Morning Glory (1995) 24bit/48KHz FLAC
description:
What is this?

This is a remastering of (What's the Story) Morning Glory, using the multichannel layer of the 2003 SACD release.

Why a downmix of Morning Glory?

Because the original CD is loud as hell, and the SACD stereo release is the same brickwalled, compressed-as-fuck mastering. The multichannel layer has much better dynamics, so with downmixing them we got a better sounding album.

So, whats the dynamic range of this!?

Pretty good, actually. Dynamic Range Meter gives it a score of DR11 (original CD is a horrible DR6). Full log on 'Technical/foo_dr.txt'

Why 48KHz and not 96KHz?

The SACD only have 22KHz of usable information (seems that this was digitally recorded and mastered), so everything above this frecuency is DSD noise a.k.a useless white noise. Proof of this in 'Technical/Morning Glory SACD cutoff.jpg', look at the lowpass at 23KHz, and the noise from 30Khz.

Why the insane clipping in "Morning Glory"?

The guitars' tracks are clipped *before mixing*, so theres nothing to do.

Processing chain?

Morning Glory SACD -> foobar2000 + foo_input_sacd (multistage DP/multichannel)    -> iZotope RX 4 (24 to 32bit float, filtering, resample) -> iZotope Ozone 7 (declipping) -> Adobe Audition CC with custom downmix matrix -> iZotope Ozone 7 (EQ and dithering) -> foobar2000 + libFLAC 1.3.1 level 8    -> MusicBrainz Picard -> Mp3tag -> foobar2000 + Lyric Show Panel

Seed, share and enjoy :)
